thread.title: This "Willy Wonka And The Chocolate Factory" Theory Is Crazy As Hell, Literally
thread.title_full: This "Willy Wonka And The Chocolate Factory" Theory Is Crazy As Hell, Literally

author: Christopher Hudspeth
title: This "Willy Wonka And The Chocolate Factory" Theory Is Crazy As Hell, Literally
text:
View this image ›
UPROXX ID: 10397305 2. To understand the theory, you’ve got to be familiar with Dante’s Inferno , a poem about a man named Dante who is taken through the different levels of hell… View this image ›
Gustave Doré ID: 10397362 3. In the poem, a ferryman named Charon carries freshly dead souls across rivers that divide the living world from the deceased… View this image ›
UPROXX / Paramount Pictures In Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory, Wonka leads the group on a legitimately terrifying boat trip into the factory.
ID: 10397461 4. Wonka’s words even seem to be describing such a descent into hell… View this image ›
Paramount Pictures “Are the fires of Hell a-glowing, is the grisly reaper mowing?”
ID: 10397555 5. The next comparison made is to Dante’s Inferno’s “nine circles of hell…” View this image ›
Gustave Doré Each circle is designed to punish a particular type of sinner, in a manner that relates to the sin. For example, the seventh circle is for violence, so a murderer might be sent there to cook in a fiery river of boiling blood.
ID: 10397819 6. Well, in Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory , the kids are punished in a way that relates to their respective “sin…” View this image ›
Paramount Pictures For example, Augustus Gloop is gluttonous for chocolate, and he almost drowns in a river of it.
ID: 10397852 7. Or Violet Beauregarde, who commits theft for stealing gum… View this image ›
Paramount Pictures And is promptly turned into a blueberry…
ID: 10397936 8. The final comparison is between their endings. At the end of Dante’s Inferno , Dante climbs up Satan and ascends out of Hell… View this image ›
Paramount Pictures In Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory , Charlie ascends off into the sky in a glass elevator.
ID: 10397994 9. All of this begs the question, is Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory a harmless story about kids in a candy factory, or is it about children experiencing some variation of the “circles of hell” from Dante’s Inferno ? View this image ›
UPROXX ID: 10398239 Video available at: https://youtube.com/watch?v=eMHSLNBFIBw . youtube.com ID: 10398247 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
